metadata.feature_description: View and manage system-generated URLs with sorting and filtering capabilities

steps.action: Navigate to Pages > Select a page > Advanced > S.E.O. tab
steps.expected: URLs for this page section displays with list of URLs
steps.actual: URLs for this page section displayed correctly showing system-generated and custom URLs in a unified table

steps.action: Select 'URL Test Page' and view its URLs
steps.expected: Multiple system-generated URLs displayed with Automatic in Generated By column
steps.actual: Four URLs displayed: two system-generated (marked 'Automatic') with paths /URL-Test-Page (200) and /URLTestPage (301), plus two custom URLs

steps.action: Click on URL, URL Type, or Generated By column headers to sort
steps.expected: URLs should be sorted by the clicked column
steps.actual: Column headers are not clickable for sorting. The URL table displays in a fixed order without interactive sorting controls

issues: No visible UI controls for sorting URLs in the page-level URL management view. The API supports sorting via sortField and sortOrder parameters, but the UI does not expose these controls.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Sort in ascending and descending order

steps.action: Attempt to toggle sort order on URL columns
steps.expected: Ability to sort ascending or descending by clicking column headers
steps.actual: No sort toggle controls available in the UI. URLs are displayed in a fixed order

issues: Sort order toggle functionality not exposed in the page-level URL management UI despite being supported by the backend API

steps.action: Look for locale filter dropdown or control in URL management view
steps.expected: Dropdown or filter to filter URLs by locale
steps.actual: No explicit locale filter control found. However, locale information is available through the Site Alias dropdown when editing a custom URL, showing multiple locale-based aliases (en-us, es-ar, fr-fr, de-de, ar-er)

issues: No dedicated locale filter in the URL list view. Locale is managed per-URL through Site Alias selection rather than as a filter on the list.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View URL details including site alias and query strings

steps.action: Click edit button on a custom URL row
steps.expected: URL details expand showing site alias, path, status, and query string fields
steps.actual: URL details expanded inline showing: Site Alias dropdown (localhost:8081/en-us), URL Path text field (/URL-Test-Page), URL Type dropdown (Active 200)

steps.action: Open Site Alias dropdown to view available aliases
steps.expected: Multiple site aliases available for selection
steps.actual: Site Alias dropdown shows 6 options: localhost:8081, localhost:8081/ar-er, localhost:8081/de-de, localhost:8081/en-us, localhost:8081/es-ar, localhost:8081/fr-fr

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify pagination for large URL lists

steps.action: View URL list on pages with multiple URLs
steps.expected: Pagination controls appear if many URLs exist
steps.actual: With 4 URLs on URL Test Page, all URLs displayed without pagination. The API design returns all URLs for the current page without pagination parameters, which is appropriate since page-level URLs are typically small in number.

observations: System-generated URLs are identified by 'Generated By: Automatic' in the UI, distinguishing them from custom URLs created by users
The URL management is page-specific - each page has its own URL settings accessed via Pages > [Page] > Advanced > S.E.O.
System URLs can have different HTTP status codes: Active (200) for canonical URLs and Redirect (301) for alternative URL forms
The API (GetSystemGeneratedUrls) supports sorting by URL/Locale/Status and ascending/descending order, but the UI does not expose these controls for page-level URL management
Locale support is implemented through Site Aliases rather than a separate locale field - each locale has its own site alias (e.g., localhost:8081/en-us, localhost:8081/fr-fr)
The UI combines system-generated and custom URLs in a single table view, differentiated only by the 'Generated By' column
Query strings field exists in the backend UrlDto but was not visible in the current URL entries (likely because none had query strings)
